## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 310, 291, 326]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Mechanics 1 (M1)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[675, 291, 866, 306]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[675, 312, 866, 327]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 373, 437, 388]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 397, 371, 414]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 426, 747, 442]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 442, 312, 456]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 456, 484, 471]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 471, 484, 486]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 485, 368, 500]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 866, 543]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions in the space provided. If additional space is required, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet. The question number(s) must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 542, 866, 571]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 690, 585]]<|/det|>
Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 585, 562, 600]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 600, 579, 615]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 628, 578, 643]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 643, 720, 658]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 658, 420, 673]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 69, 89, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 81, 784, 282]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 298, 876, 380]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a velocity-time graph which models the motion of a tractor. The graph consists of four straight line segments. The tractor passes a point \(O\) at time \(t = 0\) with speed \(U \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\). The tractor accelerates to a speed of \(V \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\) over a period of \(5 \mathrm{~s}\), and then travels at this speed for a further \(25 \mathrm{~s}\). The tractor then accelerates to a speed of \(12 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\) over a period of \(5 \mathrm{~s}\). The tractor then decelerates to rest over a period of \(15 \mathrm{~s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 390, 148, 408]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 390, 875, 425]]<|/det|>
Given that the acceleration of the tractor between \(t = 30\) and \(t = 35\) is \(0.8 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 2}\), find the value of \(V\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 408, 875, 425]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 605, 143, 623]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 605, 875, 636]]<|/det|>
Given also that the total distance covered by the tractor in the 50 seconds of motion is \(375 \mathrm{~m}\), find the value of \(U\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 621, 875, 638]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 72, 89, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 71, 875, 103]]<|/det|>
A lorry of mass \(25 000 \mathrm{~kg}\) travels along a straight horizontal road. There is a constant force of \(3000 \mathrm{~N}\) resisting the motion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 115, 149, 133]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 115, 646, 133]]<|/det|>
Find the power required to maintain a constant speed of \(30 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 116, 875, 134]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 502, 876, 549]]<|/det|>
The lorry comes to a straight hill inclined at \(2^{\circ}\) to the horizontal. The driver switches off the engine of the lorry at the point \(A\) which is at the foot of the hill. Point \(B\) is further up the hill. The speeds of the lorry at \(A\) and \(B\) are \(30 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\) and \(25 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\) respectively. The resistance force is still \(3000 \mathrm{~N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 561, 146, 579]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 561, 650, 579]]<|/det|>
Use an energy method to find the height of \(B\) above the level of \(A\).

<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 69, 850, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the difference in the speeds of the two particles at the instant when the collision occurs.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 84, 876, 102]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 72, 89, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 70, 875, 120]]<|/det|>
A block of mass \(3\mathrm{kg}\) is initially at rest on a rough horizontal plane. A force of magnitude \(6\mathrm{N}\) is applied to the block at an angle of \(\theta\) above the horizontal, where \(\cos \theta = \frac{24}{25}\). The force is applied for a period of \(5\mathrm{~s}\), during which time the block moves a distance of \(4.5\mathrm{~m}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 131, 149, 149]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 131, 566, 149]]<|/det|>
Find the magnitude of the frictional force on the block.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 131, 876, 149]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 616, 178, 633]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[178, 616, 875, 648]]<|/det|>
Show that the coefficient of friction between the block and the plane is 0.165, correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 628, 875, 645]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 69, 876, 103]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 114, 146, 131]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 114, 742, 133]]<|/det|>
Find the time, from the instant at which \(P\) is released, for \(Q\) to reach the floor.
